metadata.description: Advanced verbs - specialized actions and complex constructions

present.spanish: Me preocupo mucho por mi familia.
present.english: I worry a lot about my family.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te preocupas demasiado por el trabajo.
present.english: You (informal) worry too much about work.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me preocupo cuando no me contestas el mensaje.
present.english: I worry when you don't answer my message.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: No te preocupes; todo va a salir bien.
present.english: Don't worry; everything is going to be fine.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Mi mamá se preocupa mucho por mí.
present.english: My mom worries about me a lot.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Me preocupé mucho cuando no llegaste a casa.
preterite.english: I worried a lot when you didn't come home.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Ustedes se preocuparon por los resultados del trabajo.
preterite.english: You all worried about the work results.
preterite.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Me preocuparé menos cuando tengas trabajo estable.
future.english: I will worry less when you have stable work.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te preocuparás por tus hijos cuando sean adolescentes.
future.english: You (informal) will worry about your children when they're teenagers.
future.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te diviertes jugando videojuegos con amigos.
present.english: You (informal) have fun playing video games with friends.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te diviertes bailando tango en la milonga.
present.english: You have fun dancing tango at the milonga.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Siempre me divierto cuando salgo con mis amigos.
present.english: I always have fun when I go out with my friends.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: ¿Te diviertes en tus clases de español?
present.english: Are you having fun in your Spanish classes?
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Los niños se divierten en el parque todas las tardes.
present.english: The kids have fun at the park every afternoon.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me divertí muchísimo en la fiesta de cumpleaños.
preterite.english: I had a great time at the birthday party.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se divirtió jugando con sus nietos en el jardín.
preterite.english: He had fun playing with his grandchildren in the garden.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Me divertiré mucho en las vacaciones de verano.
future.english: I will have a lot of fun on summer vacation.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te divertirás aprendiendo a tocar la guitarra.
future.english: You (informal) will have fun learning to play guitar.
future.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te encuentras con tus amigos cada sábado.
present.english: You (informal) meet with your friends every Saturday.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Está trabajando en un proyecto importante.
present.english: He is working on an important project.
present.subject: él

quality.fix_issue: Spanish wording awkward + English translation unnatural

preterite.spanish: Me encontré con mi maestro de la escuela primaria.
preterite.english: I ran into my elementary school teacher.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se encontraron con dificultades inesperadas en el trabajo.
preterite.english: They encountered unexpected difficulties in the work.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Te encontrarás con viejos amigos en la clase.
future.english: You will meet old friends at the reunion.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se sentirá muy feliz en su nuevo trabajo.
future.english: He will feel very happy in his new job.
future.subject: él

quality.fix_issue: English unnatural; Spanish okay but formal

present.spanish: Crees que todo va a salir bien.
present.english: You believe everything will turn out well.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Cree en sus sueños y los persigue.
present.english: He believes in his dreams and pursues them.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Creyó en el trabajo desde el primer momento.
preterite.english: He believed in the work from the first moment.
preterite.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Creyó en el trabajo desde el primer momento.
preterite.english: She believed in the work from the first moment.
preterite.subject: ella

future.spanish: Creeré en ti sin importar lo que pase.
future.english: I will believe in you no matter what happens.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Creerás en los milagros después de esta experiencia.
future.english: You (informal) will believe in miracles after this experience.
future.subject: tú

present.spanish: Oye conversaciones desde su casa.
present.english: He hears conversations from his house.
present.subject: él

present.spanish: Oye conversaciones desde su casa.
present.english: She hears conversations from her house.
present.subject: ella

preterite.spanish: Oí ruidos extraños en el ático anoche.
preterite.english: I heard strange noises in the attic last night.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Oíste la noticia en la radio esta mañana.
preterite.english: You (informal) heard the news on the radio this morning.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Oiremos buenas noticias sobre el trabajo.
future.english: We will hear good news about the work.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Oiré noticias importantes en la clase de mañana.
future.english: I will hear important news at tomorrow's class.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Traigo el almuerzo de casa cada día.
present.english: I bring lunch from home every day.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Traemos comida para compartir en la casa.
present.english: We bring food to share at the house.
present.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Trajimos comida casera para compartir en la casa.
preterite.english: We brought homemade food to share at the house.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Trajeron nuevas ideas para mejorar el trabajo.
preterite.english: They brought new ideas to improve the work.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Traerás alegría a la familia con tu visita.
future.english: You will bring joy to the family with your visit.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Traeré mi guitarra para tocar en la fiesta.
future.english: I will bring my guitar to play at the party.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Mis jefes saben que en ese restaurante preparan muy buena pizza.
present.english: My bosses know that they make very good pizza at that restaurant.

quality.fix_issue: Grammar error ('Mi jefes') + missing translation + unnatural Spanish

present.spanish: Conoces todos los secretos del barrio.
present.english: You know all the neighborhood secrets.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Conocí a mi mejor amigo en la escuela.
preterite.english: I met my best friend at school.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Conoció el éxito después de años de trabajo duro.
preterite.english: He experienced success after years of hard work.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Conocerás personas interesantes en tu nuevo trabajo.
future.english: You (informal) will meet interesting people in your new job.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Conoceré muchos países cuando me jubile.
future.english: I will get to know many countries when I retire.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Cada semana, ella lleva al bebé a una guardería pública.
present.english: Every week, she takes the baby to a public daycare.

present.spanish: Llevo mi mochila al trabajo cada día.
present.english: I carry my backpack to work every day.
present.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Llevaste el trabajo al éxito con tu dedicación.
preterite.english: You led the work to success with your dedication.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Llevó flores a su madre en la casa.
preterite.english: He brought flowers to his mother in the house.
preterite.subject: él

present-progressive.spanish: Estamos llevando comida deliciosa a la fiesta.
present-progressive.english: We are carrying delicious food to the party.
present-progressive.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: Voy a llevar mi mochila al trabajo cada día.
going-to.english: I'm going to carry my backpack to work every day.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Vamos a llevar comida deliciosa a la fiesta.
going-to.english: We're going to carry delicious food to the party.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: ¿Qué vas a llevar a la fiesta?
going-to.english: What are you going to bring to the party?
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: He llevado mi mochila al trabajo cada día.
present-perfect.english: I have carried my backpack to work every day.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present.spanish: Necesito más tiempo para terminar el trabajo.
present.english: I need more time to finish the work.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Necesitas descansar después de tanto trabajo.
present.english: You (informal) need to rest after so much work.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Necesité ayuda para terminar el trabajo a tiempo.
preterite.english: I needed help to finish the work on time.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.english: He needed a job after the accident.
preterite.subject: él

going-to.spanish: Voy a necesitar más tiempo para terminar el trabajo.
going-to.english: I'm going to need more time to finish the work.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Vas a necesitar descansar después de tanto trabajo.
going-to.english: You (informal)'re going to need to rest after so much work.
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: He necesitado más tiempo para terminar el trabajo.
present-perfect.english: I have needed more time to finish the work.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Has necesitado descansar después de tanto trabajo.
present-perfect.english: You (informal) have needed to rest after so much work.
present-perfect.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me siento muy cansado hoy; no dormí bien.
present.english: I feel really tired today; I didn't sleep well.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: ¿Cómo te sientes después del ejercicio?
present.english: How do you feel after exercising?
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Ella se siente mejor con esa noticia.
present.english: She feels better with that news.
present.subject: él/ella/usted
